cells.source:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
data= {'Routine1': ['sleep', 'Ris, wash, address powerful goodness & breakfast','work','Read a book or look over accounts & dine','work','Evening: What good have I done today? (Supper, music,conversation)',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan], 
'Routine2': ['sleep','breakfast','writing in his study','walk along countryside or streets of London','dinner + spending time with family/ friends',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
'Routine3':['sleep','breakfast+beard trimming','sleeping analytic patients','lunch','walk','consultations +seeing more analytic patients','supper+playing cards/ going for a walk',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
'Routine4':['sleep','Drinks weak tea and smokes his pipe','writing','lectures','Lunch at a pub or resturant (meat & wine)','walk','visit his closest friend, Joseph Green','Work + Read',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
'Routine5':['sleep','Breakfast (coffee) & solving crossword', 'work','Lunch','work','cocktail hour & social life + dinner with wine',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
'Routine6':['Sleep','short walk + breakfast','focussed work','reading mail and spending time with his wife','work','walk+lunch+reading newspaper+letter writing','rest','walk','work','dinner (tea with egg & meat) + reading + listen to Emma playing the piano','Problem Solving'],
'Benjamin Franklin' : [ '10 pm - 5am' ,'5 am - 8 am morning' ,'8 am - 12 pm', '12 pm - 2 pm','2 pm - 6 pm','6 pm - 10 pm',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
'Charles Dickens' : ['12am - 7 am', '8am','9am-2pm' ,'2pm-5pm','6pm-12am' ,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
 'Sigmund Freud':['1am-7am','7am-8am','8am-12pm','1pm-2pm','2pm-3pm','3pm-9pm','9pm-10:30pm',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
'Imanuel Kant':['10pm-5am','5am-6am','6am-7am','7am-11am','11am-3pm','3pm-4pm','4pm-7pm','7pm-10pm',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
'W.H.Auden':['11pm-6am','6am-6:30am','7am-11:30am','11:30-12:00pm','12:00 pm-6:30pm','6:30pm-11pm',np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan,np.nan],
'Charles Darwin':['12am-7am','before 8am','8am-9:30am','9:30am-10:30am','10:30am-12pm','12pm-3:00pm','3:00pm-4:00pm','4:00pm-4:30pm','4:30pm-5:30pm','6:00pm-10:00pm','10:00pm-12:00am']}
df= pd.DataFrame( data, columns=['Benjamin Franklin' ,'Routine1','Charles Dickens','Routine2','Sigmund Freud','Routine3','Imanuel Kant','Routine4','W.H.Auden','Routine5','Charles Darwin','Routine6'])
df

cells.source:
This repo contains an introduction to [Jupyter](https://jupyter.org) and [IPython](https://ipython.org).

Outline of some basics:

* [Notebook Basics](../examples/Notebook/Notebook%20Basics.ipynb)
* [IPython - beyond plain python](../examples/IPython%20Kernel/Beyond%20Plain%20Python.ipynb)
* [Markdown Cells](../examples/Notebook/Working%20With%20Markdown%20Cells.ipynb)
* [Rich Display System](../examples/IPython%20Kernel/Rich%20Output.ipynb)
* [Custom Display logic](../examples/IPython%20Kernel/Custom%20Display%20Logic.ipynb)
* [Running a Secure Public Notebook Server](../examples/Notebook/Running%20the%20Notebook%20Server.ipynb#Securing-the-notebook-server)
* [How Jupyter works](../examples/Notebook/Multiple%20Languages%2C%20Frontends.ipynb) to run code in different languages.

You can also get this tutorial and run it on your laptop:

    git clone https://github.com/ipython/ipython-in-depth

Install IPython and Jupyter:

with [conda](https://www.anaconda.com/download):

    conda install ipython jupyter

with pip:

    # first, always upgrade pip!
    pip install --upgrade pip
    pip install --upgrade ipython jupyter

Start the notebook in the tutorial directory:

    cd ipython-in-depth
    jupyter notebook
